CandyHapsinatoR2000 0.0.0.9000.069

vignette

Source: vignettes/vignette.Rmd
vignette.Rmd

This vignette is based on CandyHapsinatoR2000 version 0.0.0.9000.69 which is avaiable on github at [https://github.com/mariegiehmoverby/CandyHapsinatoR2000].

library(CandyHapsinatoR2000)

Different handful sizes for hapsinatoR

The hapsinatoR take various arguments. One of them is handful handfulSize which is shown below.

small handful size 

small_hapsinator <- hapsinatoR(pricePer100g = 11.95,
                               snollerMoney = 46,
                               numRows = 5,
                               numCols = 20,
                               handfulSize = "small")

summary(small_hapsinator)
#> =================================
#> Summary of hapsinatoR object
#> =================================
#> Number of different candies: 100 
#> Number of candies to GRAB: 23 
#> Total grams to mix: 385 
#> Total grams mixed: 371 
#> =================================
#> Candies to GRAB are at locations:
#> (2,1)  (3,2)  (5,2)  (3,4)  (3,5)  (2,6)  (4,6)  (4,7)  (2,8)  (3,8)  (5,8)  (2,9)  (5,9)  (2,10)  (3,10)  (4,11)  (1,12)  (3,12)  (2,14)  (4,17)  (3,18)  (3,20)
plot(small_hapsinator)

## medium handful size

medium_hapsinator <- hapsinatoR(pricePer100g = 11.95,
           snollerMoney = 46,
           numRows = 5,
           numCols = 20,
           handfulSize = "medium")

summary(medium_hapsinator)
#> =================================
#> Summary of hapsinatoR object
#> =================================
#> Number of different candies: 100 
#> Number of candies to GRAB: 16 
#> Total grams to mix: 385 
#> Total grams mixed: 386 
#> =================================
#> Candies to GRAB are at locations:
#> (2,2)  (4,2)  (4,4)  (2,5)  (3,5)  (4,6)  (5,7)  (1,10)  (2,12)  (3,13)  (3,14)  (4,15)  (5,17)  (1,18)  (4,18)  (2,20)

Large handful size 

large_hapsinator <- hapsinatoR(pricePer100g = 11.95,
           snollerMoney = 46,
           numRows = 5,
           numCols = 20,
           handfulSize = "large")

summary(large_hapsinator)
#> =================================
#> Summary of hapsinatoR object
#> =================================
#> Number of different candies: 100 
#> Number of candies to GRAB: 12 
#> Total grams to mix: 385 
#> Total grams mixed: 379 
#> =================================
#> Candies to GRAB are at locations:
#> (2,2)  (1,3)  (5,5)  (3,8)  (4,8)  (1,16)  (4,17)  (1,18)  (4,18)  (2,19)  (2,20)

Friday price for the candy

We all know that ‘mix your own candy’ prices are low on fridays to accommodate Fridaytamtam on television, so let’s see how the hapsinatoR handles this.

# hapsinator with 10 kr. per  100g crandy
friday_hapsinator_10 <- hapsinatoR(pricePer100g = 10,
           snollerMoney = 50,
           numRows = 6,
           numCols = 25,
           handfulSize = "small")

summary(friday_hapsinator_10)
#> =================================
#> Summary of hapsinatoR object
#> =================================
#> Number of different candies: 150 
#> Number of candies to GRAB: 29 
#> Total grams to mix: 500 
#> Total grams mixed: 493 
#> =================================
#> Candies to GRAB are at locations:
#> (4,1)  (5,2)  (3,3)  (4,3)  (2,4)  (4,4)  (5,4)  (5,5)  (6,5)  (2,6)  (4,6)  (5,7)  (1,8)  (2,10)  (1,11)  (3,11)  (1,13)  (6,14)  (6,17)  (2,18)  (4,18)  (4,19)  (4,20)  (5,20)  (3,21)  (5,21)  (4,23)  (6,24)
# hapsinator with 8.95 kr. per  100g crandy
friday_hapsinator_8_95 <- hapsinatoR(pricePer100g = 8.95,
           snollerMoney = 50,
           numRows = 6,
           numCols = 25,
           handfulSize = "small")

summary(friday_hapsinator_8_95)
#> =================================
#> Summary of hapsinatoR object
#> =================================
#> Number of different candies: 150 
#> Number of candies to GRAB: 33 
#> Total grams to mix: 559 
#> Total grams mixed: 572 
#> =================================
#> Candies to GRAB are at locations:
#> (2,3)  (4,3)  (5,3)  (5,4)  (6,4)  (3,5)  (5,7)  (1,8)  (1,10)  (2,10)  (2,12)  (3,12)  (4,12)  (4,13)  (5,13)  (1,14)  (3,14)  (5,14)  (6,15)  (2,17)  (5,17)  (1,18)  (3,18)  (2,20)  (6,20)  (3,21)  (1,22)  (3,22)  (2,24)  (3,24)  (5,24)

Visualising the output of the hapsinatoR 

plot(medium_hapsinator)

plot(large_hapsinator)

plot(friday_hapsinator_10)

plot(friday_hapsinator_8_95)
